Question_1.Context: In a study on epoxy matrix composites filled with graphite particulates, what effect was observed on the tensile strength of the composite with an increase in graphite content?
Question_1.Question: What effect was observed on the tensile strength of the composite with an increase in graphite content?
Question_1.C: Initial increase followed by a decline
Question_1.Source: The results indicate that the addition of graphite particles significantly affects the mechanical properties of the composite. Tensile strength decreases with an increase in graphite content, with a 1wt% addition resulting in a 56% reduction in tensile strength.

Question_2.Context: What was the observed trend in flexural strength of the graphite/epoxy composites compared to the neat epoxy?
Question_2.Question: What was the observed trend in flexural strength of the graphite/epoxy composites compared to the neat epoxy?
Question_2.C: Initial increase followed by a decline
Question_2.Source: Flexural strength, on the other hand, is improved with the addition of graphite particles, although not in a linear manner. The composite with 0.1wt% graphite exhibits the highest flexural strength.

Question_3.Context: What was the impact of increasing graphite content on the hardness values of the composites?
Question_3.Question: What was the impact of increasing graphite content on the hardness values of the composites?
Question_3.C: Initial increase followed by a decline
Question_3.Source: Hardness and impact values also show improvement with higher graphite content.

Question_4.Context: How did the wear rate vary with an increase in graphite content in the epoxy composites?
Question_4.Question: How did the wear rate vary with an increase in graphite content in the epoxy composites?
Question_4.C: Initial increase followed by a decline
Question_4.Source: The experimental results indicate that the wear rate decreases with an increase in graphite content.

Question_5.Context: What was the observed trend in the friction coefficient with an increase in graphite content and applied load?
Question_5.Question: What was the observed trend in the friction coefficient with an increase in graphite content and applied load?
Question_5.C: Initial increase followed by a decline
Question_5.Source: The specimens with 1wt% graphite content consistently exhibited the lowest coefficient of friction among all applied loads and sliding speeds.

Question_6.Context: How did the wear rate vary with an increase in sliding speed in the epoxy composites?
Question_6.Question: How did the wear rate vary with an increase in sliding speed in the epoxy composites?
Question_6.C: Initial increase followed by a decline
Question_6.Source: An interesting trend observed in this study is the reduction of wear rate with an increase in sliding speed.

Question_7.Context: What was the observed failure mode in the layered composites?
Question_7.Question: What was the observed failure mode in the layered composites?
Question_7.Source: The failure mode observed in the layered specimens was delamination, characterized by interlayer debonding and changes in the crack propagation direction between the layers.

Question_8.Context: What was the impact of increasing graphite content on the impact strength of the composites?
Question_8.Question: What was the impact of increasing graphite content on the impact strength of the composites?
Question_8.C: Initial increase followed by a decline
Question_8.Source: Regarding impact strength, the incorporation of 1wt% graphite resulted in a 29% increase in impact value compared to the neat epoxy.

Question_9.Context: How did the friction coefficient change with an increase in graphite content and applied load?
Question_9.Question: How did the friction coefficient change with an increase in graphite content and applied load?
Question_9.C: Initial increase followed by a decline
Question_9.Source: The reduction in the coefficient of friction was most significant when the applied load was changed. While the sliding speed had a relatively minor effect on the coefficient of friction of the composites, a noticeable effect was observed with higher applied loads.

Question_10.Context: What was the observed trend in wear rate with an increase in sliding speed in the epoxy composites?
Question_10.Question: What was the observed trend in wear rate with an increase in sliding speed in the epoxy composites?
Question_10.C: Initial increase followed by a decline
Question_10.Source: An interesting trend observed in this study is the reduction of wear rate with an increase in sliding speed.
